lead_paragraph: The announcement comes after an aggressive campaign by General Electric to sell off billions of dollars worth of assets in its GE Capital division.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

headline.print_headline: General Electric Wins O.K. to Shed ‘Too Big to Fail’ Label
headline.main: General Electric Wins O.K. to Shed ‘Too Big to Fail’ Label

snippet: The announcement comes after an aggressive campaign by General Electric to sell off billions of dollars worth of assets in its GE Capital division.
abstract: GE Capital unit says it has shed 'too big to fail' government designation and reached goal of selling nearly $200 billion in assets; news sends GE stock up 2 percent to $30.55.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
